Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: That propranolol antagonizes the pressor effect of PPA is in contrast to the interaction in which propranolol enhances the pressor effect of norepinephrine .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| PPA (Pheochromocytoma-associated Hypertension) |

In the given paragraph, the term "PPA" refers to "Pheochromocytoma-associated Hypertension". It is a specific type of hypertension (high blood pressure) that is caused by a tumor in the adrenal gland called a pheochromocytoma. This tumor produces and releases excessive amounts of catecholamines, including norepinephrine, leading to hypertension. Therefore, PPA is the disease entity mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Pheochromocytoma-associated Hypertension (PPA) |

In the given paragraph, the term "PPA" specifically refers to "Pheochromocytoma-associated Hypertension", which is a disease characterized by hypertension (high blood pressure) caused by a tumor in the adrenal gland called a pheochromocytoma. Therefore, Pheochromocytoma-associated Hypertension (PPA) is the only valid disease entity mentioned in the paragraph. Other entities such as "propranolol" and "norepinephrine" are not diseases but rather drugs that can interact with diseases.
